S.F. working to open supervised drug use site by spring, possibly near the Tenderloin

Even though supervised consumption sites are currently illegal under federal and state law, San Francisco Mayor London Breed is forging ahead on a policy that could allow the city to open one. Breed is pushing to open a site as early as the spring, working to acquire a building near the Tenderloin that could house the program.
